main event: On December 17th, 1955, an unidentified object was observed exploding in the sky, changing colors from white to red to blue. The sighting lasted for approximately 15 seconds.
interesting points: The object changed colors from white to red to blue and was observed to explode in the sky.
The sighting was believed to be caused by a meteorite, supported by the observations of multiple witnesses and the collective professional opinion of experts.
The object was described as moving in a characteristic downward trajectory, similar to a meteorite of unusual size.
Witnesses in different locations had varying interpretations of the object's behavior, with some believing it burned out and others thinking it struck the earth.
Despite initial speculation, the investigation concluded that the object was a high altitude natural phenomenon and not an unknown or unidentified flying object.
sighted object: an unidentified object exploding in the sky
witnesses: Captains, commercial pilots, CAA control tower operators, and high school students
